intro: Orthion guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan orthion, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Guatemala. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture. Orthion guatemalense is often found in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially shaded environments.
